message.say: Always remember the flow chart we saw in the beginning of the lesson when defining unknown words.

message.name: A59
message.say: by going through all of the words that Jordan does not know we are all gaining a better understanding for the article and the topic of the article.

message.name: A60

message.name: A61

message.name: A62
message.say: Yes Jordan! Take a look at this chart that describes steps to defining words you don't know.

message.name: A63
message.say: Step 1 shows us that we have to find context clues. You do this by looking for words or phrases in the surrounding sentences in a passage. You can find words that have similar or different meanings that will help you figure out the definition of the word you don't know.

message.name: A64
message.say: In this activity if you are struggling with finding context clues, I will help you by flashing certain context clues in the passage to help you figure out the definition.

message.name: A65
message.say: Yes Jordan! Like an 18 wheeler! 18 wheelers are distinctive because they are larger and easier to see!

message.name: A67

message.name: A68

message.name: A69
message.say: Hi

message.name: A70

message.name: A71
message.say: We will help you Jordan! Today we can try defining words by looking at context clues in the text.

message.name: A72

message.name: A73

message.name: A74

message.name: A75
message.say: Jordan is the flow chart beginning to make sense?

message.name: A76
message.say: Jordan what is the next word you needed help with?

message.name: A77
message.say: Next you have to create your own definition for the word based on the context clues. This definition can be as short or as long as you'd like... just as long as it helps you define the word you don't know.

message.name: A78
message.say: Let's see it Jordan!

message.name: A79
message.say: when helping Jordan define the words he does not know, Keep in mind our flow chart with the 4 steps, finding context clues, creating a definition, replacing the word with our definition, and seeing if our definition makes sense in the sentence... Go ahead and read the article and click to continue when you are finished.

message.name: A80
message.say: The word untidy means that something is messy Jordan.

message.name: A81
message.say: Let's stay on track Jordan! Let's see another word you are having trouble defining.

message.name: A82
message.say: Jordan let's see your second article!

message.name: A83
message.say: you will be doing the same thing you did in the last article. Remember to use context clues to help you define the words Jordan highlights.

message.name: A84
message.say: The article will be able to explain this better than I can Jordan, but black Holes are stars that have exploded. Once this happens their gravity is so strong that they suck up everything that is near them!

message.name: A85
message.say: I hope you guys enjoyed this lesson with me!

message.name: A86
message.say: You guys did great! To recap, let's look at the flow chart. first we find context clues,next we create our own definition,from there we replace our definition in the sentence to see if it makes sense, then if it does make sense, we got the definition! If not, we have to start over at step 1.

message.name: A87
message.say: Always try to think about these steps when you two are facing a tough word that has to be defined.

message.name: A88
message.say: Good bye have a great day!

message.name: A89
message.say: Right Jordan! The moon and Earth interact with each other by spinning or rotating around each other!

message.name: A90
message.say: You're welcome Jordan! so, you said you had one final word highlighted?

message.name: A91
message.say: Now, in step 3 you replace the word you don't know with the definition you created in step 2.

message.name: A92
message.say: Finally! In step 4, You ask yourself, does my definition of the word make sense in the sentence? If it does then you got it! You just defined a word you didn't know! But! If it doesn't, then go back to step one until your definition fits the sentence

message.name: A93
message.say: Great!

message.name: A94
message.say: Here is Jordan's first article, it is about galaxies! Help him define words he doesn't know by using context clues and the steps we just learned! When you are finished, please click to continue at the bottom of the passage!

message.name: A95
message.say: Let's see the last word Jordan!

message.name: A96
message.say: and Jordan Sprawling means to cover a large area in an untidy way. So, here we learn that Galaxies cover large areas of the universe and they can appear untidy.

message.name: A97
message.say: look at the context clues countless and cannot be counted that I just gave you! If there are countless numbers of stars that cannot be counted, will these stars be in small areas? Or will they cover a large areas? Use this hint to define the word sprawling.

message.name: A98
message.say: Sprawling means to cover a large area in an untidy way. So, here we learn that Galaxies cover large areas of the universe and they can appear untidy.
